value.title: McConnell blames Trump but voted not guilty anyway
value.excerpt: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell has told his colleagues that he will vote to acquit former President Donald Trump of inciting the insurrection at the US Capitol last month, according to a source familiar with the conversations.

value.title: Home of Trump attorney Michael van der Veen vandalized
value.excerpt: The home of Trump defense attorney Michael van der Veen was vandalized Friday night.

value.title: The ‘Disgraceful Acquittal’ of Donald Trump
value.excerpt: A sad, sad day for democracy,” one reader writes. “It was craven cowardice for Republicans to put Mr. Trump before country,” writes another.

value.title: Pull of partisanship helps Trump escape impeachment conviction: ANALYSIS
value.excerpt: While seven Republicans joined all 50 Democrats in voting for former President Donald Trump 's conviction, the Senate fell 10 votes short of conviction. Trump was spared the ultimate punishment Congress could wield by powerful and familiar forces he has long understood,

value.title: Trump was aware Pence had been evacuated to secure location as rioters stormed Capitol
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump was aware his vice president had been evacuated to a secure location as rioters stormed the US Capitol, according to a person who was with Trump on January 6.

value.title: Pence's former chief of staff has been contacted about providing information in impeachment trial
value.excerpt: Marc Short, former Vice President Mike Pence's chief of staff, has been contacted about providing information to House impeachment managers about threats to Pence during last month's Capitol riot, a source familiar with the matter tells CNN.

value.title: Biden administration expresses 'deep concerns' about WHO's China probe
value.excerpt: The Biden administration on Saturday expressed "deep concerns" about the World Health Organization’s (WHO) probe into the Chinese handling of the coronavirus.

value.title: Full Text on Mitch McConnell's Email Explaining Why He Would Vote to Acquit Trump
value.excerpt: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell will vote to acquit former President Donald Trump, he told colleagues on Saturday.

value.title: Republican Rep. Herrera Beutler highlights phone call as riot raged: Trump said to have blamed antifa, enraging McCarthy
value.excerpt: Keving McCarthy, furious, said “Who the f--k do you think you are talking to?” to the then-president, CNN reported.

value.title: Ivanka played peacemaker in Trump and Pence's 'uncomfortable' first meeting after Capitol riots, report says
value.excerpt: Jared Kushner, who also helped arrange the meeting, later jokingly compared it to his efforts at brokering peace in the Middle East, the report says.

value.title: Live impeachment updates: Trump's legal team, House prosecutors eye closing arguments with witness question unanswered
value.excerpt: Both sides are readying themselves for closing arguments in the Trump impeachment trial. But the decision on whether to call witnesses is unresolved.

value.title: Trump attorneys falsely claim he was denied ‘due process’
value.excerpt: Due process is a bedrock protection for anyone facing a loss of “life, liberty or property” — not public office.

value.title: Biden will try to close Guantanamo after ‘robust’ review
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden will seek to close the prison on the U.S. base at Guantanamo Bay following a review process, resuming a project begun under the Obama administration, the White House said Friday.

value.title: Biden launches review of Guantanamo prison, aims to close it before leaving office
value.excerpt: President Joe Biden's aides have launched a formal review of the U.S. military prison at Guantanamo Bay in Cuba, reviving the Obama-era goal of closing the controversial facility with the aim of doing so before he leaves office,

value.title: In a Disorienting Return to Civility, Joe Biden’s DOJ Backs Up Betsy DeVos
value.excerpt: Joe Biden’s campaign message was all about restoring order to Washington, a return of professionalism to government and an embrace of D.C.’s norms.

value.title: Florida Democrat says Biden vaccine distribution plan hurts states with high senior populations
value.excerpt: Florida Democratic Rep. Stephanie Murphy urged President Biden to adjust his plan for distributing vaccines nationwide after finding "obvious flaws" that could prove detrimental to states with higher rates of seniors.

value.title: Fact check: Trump lawyers make multiple false claims in impeachment defense
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump's lawyers mounted an aggressive defense Friday in Trump's second impeachment trial -- and made multiple false and misleading claims to bolster their case.

value.title: Biden administration says it intends to close Guantanamo prison
value.excerpt: The Biden administration intends to close the Guantánamo Bay detention facility, which houses approximately 40 prisoners, by the end of their term.

value.title: Fact Check: Is Joe Biden Responsible For the Rising Cost of Insulin?
value.excerpt: Recently, many Americans have been expressing their outrage on social media at the rising cost of insulin and wonder who is to blame.

value.title: Trump's impeachment defense team rests, arguing his words before riot were 'ordinary political rhetoric'
value.excerpt: Trump's impeachment defense team argues his words before riot were 'ordinary political rhetoric' A final vote on whether to convict the ex-president for inciting the Capitol riot could happen this weekend.

value.title: DC attorney general weighs legal viability of charging Trump under local statute
value.excerpt: Lawyers inside the Washington, DC attorney general's office are working to determine if it is legally viable to use district statutes to charge former President Donald Trump for his alleged role in the insurrection.

value.title: Mike Pompeo urges Biden to 'confront China head-on' like Trump administration
value.excerpt: The Biden administration has to confront China "head-on" the same way the previous administration did, former Trump Administration Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said on Friday.

value.title: Trump's defense team calls impeachment trial 'political vengeance'
value.excerpt: Donald Trump's lawyers on Friday began laying out their case for why the former president should be acquitted of inciting last month's deadly riot at the U.S. Capitol, arguing the impeachment trial was an act of "political vengeance" by Democrats.

value.title: Key Republican breaks with Trump: 'We shouldn't have followed him'
value.excerpt: Former ambassador to the UN Nikki Haley weighed in on Trump's legacy during an interview with Politico, saying that he had "fallen so far" and was likely out of the picture for 2024 presidential candidates. Former special assistant to President George H.W. Bush and president of the Council on Foreign

value.title: Mike Pence's 'nuclear football' was potentially at risk during Capitol riot
value.excerpt: Footage from 6 January shows mob was within 30 metres of Pence and air force officer carrying briefcase with nuclear codes
